MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder HasComputedColumnSql (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder primitiveCollectionBuilder);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder HasComputedColumnSql(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder primitiveCollectionBuilder) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function HasComputedColumnSql (primitiveCollectionBuilder As PrimitiveCollectionBuilder) As PrimitiveCollectionBuilder
static member HasComputedColumnSql : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder

Docs.param: The builder for the property being configured.
Docs.summary: Configures the property to map to a computed column when targeting a relational database.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

remarks.para: When called with no arguments, this method tells EF that a column is computed without needing to specify the actual SQL used to computed it. This can be useful when mapping EF to an existing database.
See Database default values for more information and examples.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder HasComputedColumnSql (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder primitiveCollectionBuilder, string? sql, bool? stored);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder HasComputedColumnSql(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder primitiveCollectionBuilder, string sql, valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> stored) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function HasComputedColumnSql (primitiveCollectionBuilder As PrimitiveCollectionBuilder, sql As String, stored As Nullable(Of Boolean)) As PrimitiveCollectionBuilder

static member HasComputedColumnSql : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder * string * Nullable<bool> -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder

Docs.param: The builder for the property being configured.
The SQL expression that computes values for the column.

If , the computed value is calculated on row modification and stored in the database like a regular column. If , the value is computed when the value is read, and does not occupy any actual storage. selects the database provider default.
Docs.summary: Configures the property to map to a computed column when targeting a relational database.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: See Database default values for more information and examples.

static member HasDefaultValue : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder

Docs.param: The builder for the property being configured.
Docs.summary: Configures the default value for the column that the property maps to when targeting a relational database.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

remarks.para: When called with no argument, this method tells EF that a column has a default value constraint of some sort without needing to specify exactly what it is. This can be useful when mapping EF to an existing database.
See Database default values for more information and examples.

Docs.param: The builder for the property being configured.
A value indicating whether the property is constrained to fixed length values.
Docs.summary: Configures the property as capable of storing only fixed-length data, such as strings.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: See Modeling entity types and relationships for more information and examples.

static member UseCollation : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder * string -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.PrimitiveCollectionBuilder

Docs.param: The builder for the property being configured.
The collation for the column.
Docs.summary: Configures the property to use the given collation. The database column will be created with the given collation, and it will be used implicitly in all collation-sensitive operations.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: See Database collations for more information and examples.
